title.label: the BEST racing game on the market!

content.label: i had recently heard that this game was ported to IOS, and i instantly bought it! and to no one‚Äôs surprise, this is an amazing port of the console version! this has to be the BEST mobile racing game you can get, and its worth every last penny. it does burn your battery down extremely fast, but there is a battery saver mode that does the job. the controls can take time to get used to, but you can customize it to your will so anyone can get the hang of it quickly. and if you‚Äôre a console player like me, it has MFI controller support. Feral did an absolutely wonderful job porting this to mobile, and all of the DLC is free, of course. if you‚Äôre looking to play a racing game on your phone, choose this one overall! you get EVERYTHING at the start, so you don‚Äôt need to work for anything. this is a one of a kind game!

title.label: Fantastic race sim, best for mobile but one problem.

content.label: Been playing this excellent racing sim since it was released and it‚Äôs fantastic. I play on an iPad Pro 9.7 and it was great until this update a few days ago. I tried uninstalling and reinstalling and even a completely fresh install of iPad OS 14 and no change. Is there any way to revert to the previous version of this game?

title.label: Not an arcade style game people!

content.label: Just wanted to let the folks who are complaining about how difficult the car is to control to go back to their favorite arcade racer. First of all nothing is gonna control like a real car so lower your expectations. Second, as far as iPad racing games go, wow! You have to compare apples to apples. Sure it‚Äôs not a console game, but it‚Äôs the closet thing going. The only complaint I have for the developers is that the manual shifting is a little tough and I wish there was a way to apply variable pressure to the throttle and brakes. If there is, please let me know. Having to go full throttle or full braking every time you touch the petals makes for a lot of spin outs and locked up brakes. Otherwise, great game!

title.label: Closing Thing To a Racing Sim on Mobile

content.label: I was a RR3 addict for a couple of years - until GRID came along. It took me a long time to get used to the controls, and patience is reuiredy, but the game is a blast. Physics are Superior to anything else on mobile. The only weaknesses are the somewhat limited car selection and the blurry cockpit view.

I was looking to scratch an itch for something like forza to play on my ipad while sitting in bed, and this game is the solution. I play with my ipad held up by some cheap flexible mount and an xbox controller and let me tell you what, it is pretty dang close to console quality. I‚Äôve only played career mode so far and it has a slight mobile zing to it. The racing itself is incredible, but I wish there was a little more diversity to the cars. It feels like I‚Äôm using the same cars over and over, regardless of what sponsor I pick. I really wish you could purchase your own for each type of race, and upgrade as you go. With all that said, for a $10 game it‚Äôs 5 out of 5 stars without a doubt.

title.label: New update creates more problems than it solves.

content.label: The game continues to ask me to update even after I already did. Plus I am discovering loss of sound sometimes.

title.label: Most Immersive Racing Game for Mobile

content.label: I believe that this is one of the best games that you can get for your phone. This immersive game has outstanding features that made me question if this game really was on iOS. You can customize this racing game to fit you, and it has a little bit of challenge involved which makes the game more spectacular. GRID: Autosport is one of my favorite games on console. If you compare the mobile version and the console version, they are almost the same. Feral not only brought the amazing features and mechanics from the console version, but they ported the amazing game graphics to mobile, and I was surprised that they could do such thing. The game is at a pricey 15 dollars, but it is totally worth it, and you shouldn‚Äôt worry. All the DLC‚Äôs are free, and the game itself is excellent. Even though all of this makes an amazing game, I have just one concern. My concern is with the cockpit view. I was expecting a nice dashboard with a speedometer, but instead, all of it was blurred out, and I was not impressed. Even though the game has amazing graphics and mechanics, without a few things, a game can lose its point. A nice cockpit view makes the game more immersive and more realistic, and it can make the game just, more fun. These small things can make a game much better. I really don‚Äôt mind if the cockpit view is the same for each car, but Feral, if you are reading this review, please add a cockpit view for each car. I would really appreciate it. I am recommending this game to all my friends just because of how immersive the game is. But, please, to make this game better, please add a cockpit view. Other than that, I believe that this game is fabulous as it can be played on a hand held device on the go, and I will rate this game 5 stars because of its beauty and excellence.

This game has amazing graphics, but there is one thing it lacks..

A tutorial.

This game‚Äôs controls and layout are very easy, but only if you know what all the different car types do and what they are for. I can‚Äôt easily find my favorite car without searching for a while. The controls are difficult but hard to master- this game is designed to be a racing simulation, so it is hard to master, but fun to play.

4/5 for no tutorial. That sort of messed up my experience.
